item.text: **Preparing updates for project configuration and gitignore**

item.aggregated_output:
[build-system]
requires = ["setuptools>=61.0", "wheel"]
build-backend = "setuptools.build_meta"

[project]
name = "my-project"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Template Python project with stranske/Workflows CI integration"
readme = "README.md"
requires-python = ">=3.11"
license = {text = "MIT"}
authors = [
    {name = "Your Name", email = "your.email@example.com"},
]
classifiers = [
    "Development Status :: 3 - Alpha",
    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
]
dependencies = []

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=9.0.2",
    "pytest-cov>=7.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.14.10",
    "mypy>=1.19.1",
]

[project.urls]
Homepage = "https://github.com/stranske/Template"
Repository = "https://github.com/stranske/Template"

[tool.setuptools.packages.find]
where = ["src"]

[tool.pytest.ini_options]
testpaths = ["tests"]
addopts = "-v --cov=src --cov-report=term-missing --cov-report=xml"
pythonpath = ["src"]

[tool.coverage.run]
source = ["src"]
branch = true

[tool.coverage.report]
exclude_lines = [
    "pragma: no cover",
    "def __repr__",
    "raise NotImplementedError",
    "if TYPE_CHECKING:",
    "if __name__ == .__main__.:",
]
fail_under = 80

[tool.ruff]
target-version = "py311"
line-length = 100
src = ["src", "tests"]

[tool.ruff.lint]
select = [
    "E",    # pycodestyle errors
    "F",    # pyflakes
    "I",    # isort
    "N",    # pep8-naming
    "W",    # pycodestyle warnings
    "UP",   # pyupgrade
    "B",    # flake8-bugbear
    "C4",   # flake8-comprehensions
    "SIM",  # flake8-simplify
]
ignore = [
    "E501",  # line too long (handled by formatter)
]

[tool.ruff.lint.isort]
known-first-party = ["my_project"]

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.11"
strict = true
warn_return_any = true
warn_unused_configs = true
disallow_untyped_defs = true
disallow_incomplete_defs = true
check_untyped_defs = true
no_implicit_optional = true
warn_redundant_casts = true
warn_unused_ignores = true
show_error_codes = true

[[tool.mypy.overrides]]
module = "tests.*"
disallow_untyped_defs = false

# Codex working files (preserved via workflow artifacts, not git)
# These files are rebuilt each run and would cause merge conflicts
# if multiple PRs commit them. Historical data is preserved in:
# - PR comments (completion summaries)
# - Workflow artifacts (full outputs)
# - Commit messages (change descriptions)

./codex-prompt-24.md:157:- [ ] Add streamlit dependency to pyproject.toml optional-dependencies

# Collab-Admin

Control plane for the stranske collaboration project. This repository defines policies, protocols, rubrics, submission templates, review workflows, time/expense tracking, dashboards, and validation scripts for the collaboration.

## Purpose

Collab-Admin serves as the **single source of truth** for:
- Operating model and governance ([docs/01-operating-model.md](docs/01-operating-model.md))
- Security boundaries and access control ([docs/02-security-boundaries.md](docs/02-security-boundaries.md))
- Submission standards and review rubrics ([rubrics/](rubrics/))
- Time tracking and compensation protocols ([docs/04-time-tracking-policy.md](docs/04-time-tracking-policy.md))
- Public-facing dashboards ([dashboards/public/](dashboards/public/))
- Validation and quality assurance scripts ([scripts/](scripts/))

This repo was initialized by layering the [Collab-Admin starter kit](collab-admin-starter-kit-v4.zip) onto the [stranske/Template](https://github.com/stranske/Template) structure to leverage shared automation from [stranske/Workflows](https://github.com/stranske/Workflows).

## Repository Structure

```
Collab-Admin/
├── config/
│   ├── project.yml              # Project configuration
│   └── dashboard_public.yml     # Public dashboard config
├── docs/                        # Policy and protocol documentation
│   ├── 00-charter.md           # Project charter and goals
│   ├── 01-operating-model.md   # Work processes and constraints
│   ├── 02-security-boundaries.md # Access control and secrets
│   ├── 03-ai-policy.md         # AI usage guidelines
│   ├── 04-time-tracking-policy.md # Time logging requirements
│   ├── 05-definition-of-done.md # Completion criteria
│   ├── 06-review-workflow.md   # PR review process
│   ├── 07-compensation-expenses.md # Payment protocols
│   ├── 08-month-end-settlement.md # Monthly reconciliation
│   ├── 09-trend-review-protocol.md # Trend model analysis
│   ├── 10-agent-integration-protocol.md # Claude Code integration
│   ├── 11-consumer-usability-protocol.md # Usability validation
│   ├── 12-marketplace-plan-protocol.md # Marketplace research
│   ├── 13-project-instrumentation-roadmap.md # Observability
│   └── 14-workflows-ecosystem.md # Automation architecture
├── rubrics/

item.text:
**Summarizing update status and next steps**

I’m preparing a clear explanation about what’s done—like updating `pyproject.toml`, `.gitignore`, and adding Streamlit to dev extras—and noting that I committed changes but haven’t run `pip install` because of network limits. I’m also planning to highlight pending steps the user might want to try next, such as running the install command or considering egg-info changes, plus mentioning files with uncommitted changes and the current verification state.

Updated project metadata to match Collab-Admin and expanded gitignore patterns; these changes are in `pyproject.toml` and `.gitignore` to align name/description/URLs, first‑party module, streamlit dev extra, and codex/logs ignores.

- Updated `pyproject.toml` with name `collab-admin`, Collab-Admin description, repo URLs, `known-first-party`, and added `streamlit` under `dev` extras in `pyproject.toml`.
- Added `codex-prompt-*.md`, `codex-output-*.md`, and `logs/` to `.gitignore` in `.gitignore`.
- Commit created: `Update project metadata and gitignore`.

Notes:
- I didn’t run `pip install -e ".[dev]"` because network access is restricted here.
- There are pre-existing unstaged changes in `src/my_project.egg-info/PKG-INFO` and `src/my_project.egg-info/SOURCES.txt` plus `codex-session-24.jsonl` that I did not touch.

Next steps:
1. Run `pip install -e ".[dev]"` to satisfy the acceptance criterion.
2. Decide how you want to handle the existing `src/my_project.egg-info/PKG-INFO` and `src/my_project.egg-info/SOURCES.txt` changes.
